page.title: netPanzer - An Online Multiplayer Tactical Warfare Game

subsection.title: Linux
subsection.p: Some linux distributions already come with netpanzer packages by default. You might just be able to install netpanzer with your distributions software setup tool. This is true for at least the following distributions
subsection.subsubsection:
rpm files for Suse and other distributions can be found at the
netPanzer download section.

subsubsection.title: Debian
subsubsection.p:
If you're using Debian unstable (Sid), you can add the following lines to your /etc/apt/sources.list file:
deb http://mentors.debian.net/debian unstable main contrib non-free
deb-src http://mentors.debian.net/debian unstable main contrib non-free
run apt-get update and then apt-get install netpanzer.
Debian packages are provided by Bartosz Fenski aka fEnIo fenio@o2.pl

subsubsection.title: Installer, Static Binary
subsubsection.p: A loki installer and a statically linked binary are in the works.

subsection.title: Windows
subsection.p: A windows version with installer is in the works.

subsection.title: MacOSX
subsection.p: Currently netpanzer code does not work correctly on big-endian machines like PPC. However we're trying to fix this for future versions. Help in this area is welcome.

subsection.title: Source Code
subsection.p: You need both the gamedata and the source if you want to compile yourself, in addition you need Jam, PhysicsFS, SDL, SDL_net, SDL_mixer, SDL_image and SDL_ttf, see the README for details.
Older releases and other files are available via the Berlios's Filelist.

subsubsection.title: CVS
subsubsection.p: Source Code is also available via CVS. Look at the netpanzer cvs page for details.
